RenyiExtropy 0.3.0

Conditional Rényi Extropy

conditional_renyi_extropy.Rd

Computes the conditional Rényi extropy \(J_q(Y \mid X)\) for two discrete random variables, given their joint probability matrix.

Usage

conditional_renyi_extropy(Pxy, q)

Arguments

Pxy

A numeric matrix representing the joint probability distribution \(P_{ij}\) (rows correspond to values of \(X\), columns correspond to values of \(Y\)). All entries must be non-negative and sum to 1.

q

A numeric scalar specifying the Rényi parameter. Must satisfy \(q > 0\) and \(q \neq 1\).

Value

A numeric scalar giving the conditional Rényi extropy.

Details

The conditional Rényi extropy is defined as: $$ J_q(Y \mid X) = J_q(X, Y) - J_q(X) $$ where \(J_q(\cdot)\) denotes the Rényi extropy. As \(q \to 1\), this converges to the conditional Shannon extropy.

See also

renyi_extropy()

Examples

Pxy <- matrix(c(0.2, 0.3, 0.1, 0.4), nrow = 2, byrow = TRUE)
conditional_renyi_extropy(Pxy, 2)
#> [1] 0.1039623
